org.opentcs.util.communication.tcp

Class TcpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentcs.util.communication.tcp.TcpConnection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveTcpConnection, DummyTcpConnection, PassiveTcpConnection

    public abstract class TcpConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    A connection to a peer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  TcpConnection.TelegramReceiverTask
      A task that continuously waits for incoming data from the vehicle and processes it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
      Buffer size for reading data from the TCP stream.

    • Field Detail

      • RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE

        protected static final int RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
        Buffer size for reading data from the TCP stream.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpConnection

        protected TcpConnection()
        Creates a new TcpConnection.

      • TcpConnection

        protected TcpConnection(int reconnectDelay)
        Creates a new TcpConnection.
        Parameters:
        reconnectDelay - A delay (in ms) to wait before re-establishing the connection after it was disconnected.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        protected final boolean isActive()
        Checks whether this connection should be up, i.e. if it should re-connect automatically on connection loss. This does not indicate the actual connection state, which can be down at least temporarily.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this connection should be up.

      • deactivate

        protected final void deactivate()
        Deactivates this connection, indicating that it is not going to be used any more.

      • addStateListener

        public final void addStateListener(ConnectionStateListener newListener)
        Registers a state listener with this connection.
        Parameters:
        newListener - The listener to be registered.

      • removeStateListener

        public final void removeStateListener(ConnectionStateListener rmListener)
        Unregisters a state listener from this connection.
        Parameters:
        rmListener - The listener to be unregistered.

      • isConnected

        public abstract boolean isConnected()
        Checks whether the connection to the vehicle is currently up, i.e. whether communication is possible.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the connection to the vehicle is currently up.

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the peer and deactivates this connection. After disconnecting, this VehicleConnection cannot be used for another connection to peer; instead, a new instance must be created. If already disconnected, this method does nothing.

      • sendTelegram

        public abstract void sendTelegram(byte[] telegram)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given sequence of bytes to the peer.
        Parameters:
        telegram - The sequence of bytes to be sent to the peer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs trying to send the given data, or if the connection currently isn't up.

      • establishConnection

        protected abstract void establishConnection()
        (Re-)establish a connection to the vehicle. This method is called by the receiver task if the connection should be up but is currently down.

      • processVehicleTelegrams

        protected abstract void processVehicleTelegrams()
        Read what the vehicle has sent to us. This method is called by the receiver task to wait for incoming data from the vehicle and process it.
